title: AB 2676
content:
The people of the State of California enact the following. Section 17052.6 of the Revenue and Taxation Code is amended to allow a credit against the "net tax" for expenses related to household and dependent care services necessary for gainful employment. The credit amount is determined based on the Internal Revenue Code, with a percentage of the allowable federal credit without considering federal tax liability. For taxable years before January 1, 2003, the percentage of the allowable federal credit is determined for household and dependent care services necessary for gainful employment. Adjusted gross income determines the percentage of the federal credit for household and dependent care services necessary for gainful employment. The credit percentages vary based on income brackets, with higher incomes receiving lower percentages or no credit at all. Adjusted gross income determines the percentage of the federal credit for household and dependent care services necessary for gainful employment. The credit percentages vary based on income brackets, with higher incomes receiving lower percentages or no credit at all. For taxable years beginning on or after January 1, 2019, the credit percentages are as follows:
- $100,000 or less: 200%
- Over $100,000 but not over $125,000: 100%
- Over $125,000 but not over $150,000: 50%
- Over $150,000: 0%
- $40,000 or less: 65%
- Over $40,000 but not over $70,000: 50%
- Over $70,000 but not over $100,000: 34%
- Over $100,000: 0% Adjusted gross income determines the percentage of the federal credit for household and dependent care services necessary for gainful employment. The credit percentages vary based on income brackets, with higher incomes receiving lower percentages or no credit at all. For taxable years beginning on or after January 1, 2019, the credit percentages are as follows:
- $40,000 or less: 50%
- Over $40,000 but not over $70,000: 43%
- Over $70,000 but not over $100,000: 34%
- Over $100,000: 0%
Adjusted gross income for this section is defined as computed for purposes of paragraph (2) of subdivision (h) of Section 17024.5. The credit authorized by this section is limited based on income brackets. The credit authorized by this section is limited to household and dependent care services necessary for gainful employment provided in the state, with a maximum credit of 34% for incomes over $100,000. Adjusted gross income is defined as computed for paragraph (2) of subdivision (h) of Section 17024.5. Employment-related expenses for household and dependent care services necessary for gainful employment are limited to services provided in the state. Earned income subject to tax under this part is limited to compensation received by members of the Armed Forces for active services. For tax purposes, compensation received by members of the Armed Forces for active services is considered earned income subject to tax, regardless of domicile. Additionally, a child, as defined in the Internal Revenue Code, is subject to age requirements. For tax purposes, a child is defined as receiving over one-half of their support from the parent with custody for a greater portion of the year, who is then considered the "custodial parent" under the Internal Revenue Code. This classification allows the child to be treated as a qualifying individual for tax benefits. The child must receive over one-half of their support from parents who never married and lived apart during the last six months of the year. The child must also be in the custody of one or both parents for more than one-half of the year. Amendments to this section apply to taxable years beginning in 2002 and 2011. The amendments made to this section by Chapter 14 of the Statutes of 2011 apply to taxable years starting on or after January 1, 2011. This act enacts a tax levy and takes immediate effect.
